skill.name: ai-phill
skill.description: Strategic advisor for founders. Facilitates deep thinking through Socratic dialogue, identifies blind spots, assesses risks and opportunities, and provides guidance on strategic decisions using Extended Thinking for complex analysis.
skill.summary: Strategic advisor for founders. Facilitates deep thinking through Socratic dialogue, identifies blin...
skill.author: CleanExpo

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill containing only documentation and conversation templates. There is NO executable code, no file system access, no network operations, and no code execution capabilities. All 46 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES caused by the analyzer misidentifying documentation text as code patterns. The backticks are for markdown code formatting, not shell execution. The URLs are source references, not network targets. No security risk present.

content.user_title: Get strategic advice through Socratic questioning
content.value_statement: Founders face complex decisions without unbiased guidance. AI Phill facilitates deep thinking through Socratic dialogue to identify blind spots and assess strategic options objectively.
actual_capabilities: Guides strategic decisions through Socratic questioning
Identifies cognitive biases and blind spots
limitations: Advisory only - cannot make decisions for you
Requires active participation and honest answers
May need multiple sessions for complex decisions
Cannot access real-time market or competitor data

use_cases.title: Series A vs Bootstrap Decision
use_cases.description: Explore funding options through structured questioning about vision, trade-offs, and personal alignment

use_cases.title: Product Pivot Assessment
use_cases.description: Test assumptions and explore alternatives before making major strategic changes

use_cases.title: Hiring Strategy Evaluation
use_cases.description: Analyze whether to hire senior roles or explore alternative solutions first

prompt_templates.title: Explore Decision
prompt_templates.scenario: When facing any major strategic choice
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me think through [decision]. I'm considering [option A] vs [option B]. What questions should I ask myself?

prompt_templates.title: Test Assumption
prompt_templates.scenario: When you have a core belief about your business
prompt_templates.prompt: I assume that [assumption]. What evidence supports this? What if I'm wrong?

prompt_templates.title: Scenario Analysis
prompt_templates.scenario: Before committing to a major initiative
prompt_templates.prompt: Model the scenarios for [decision] over [timeframe]. What are best/worst/most likely outcomes?

prompt_templates.title: Values Alignment
prompt_templates.scenario: When personal values conflict with business decisions
prompt_templates.prompt: Does [decision] align with my core values of [value 1] and [value 2]? What trade-offs am I making?

output_examples.input: Should I raise a Series A or continue bootstrapping?
output: Let's explore this through multiple dimensions:
VISION & TIMING
- What does success look like in 5 years for each path?
- How does capital change your timeline vs bootstrapping?
TRADE-OFFS ANALYSIS
- Series A: Gain capital/expertise, lose control/equity
- Bootstrapping: Keep control, slower growth
READINESS ASSESSMENT
- Are you raising to solve a problem or accelerate?
- Do you have product-market fit evidence?
PERSONAL IMPACT
- How would each path affect your quality of life?
- Which aligns better with your values?
What resonates most? Let's dig deeper into those areas.

output_examples.input: I assume our first-mover advantage will guarantee market success
output: Let's test that assumption together:
FIRST-MOVER ADVANTAGE
- In which markets is this true? (Often false in tech)
- What advantages are you actually seeing right now?
- Who are your fastest followers and what can they learn?
COMPETITIVE CONTEXT
- Who else might enter this market?
- What resources do they have?
- Can they move faster or spend more?
What evidence would prove this assumption right or wrong?

best_practices: Be honest about your assumptions and biases - AI Phill cannot help if you hold back
Allow time for reflection between sessions - major decisions benefit from multiple conversations
Document your reasoning - helps track decision quality over time
anti_patterns: Asking for quick answers - AI Phill asks questions, does not provide them
Seeking validation for decisions already made - use it to test thinking instead
Using it as replacement for customer research or market validation

faq.question: Is AI Phill compatible with Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, AI Phill works with Claude Code and Claude. It uses natural language conversation to guide strategic thinking.

faq.question: What are the daily usage limits?
faq.answer: No hard limits, but complex strategic analysis may use 10,000+ tokens per session. Plan accordingly for your API budget.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with my existing advisor network?
faq.answer: AI Phill complements human advisors by helping you prepare better questions and think through options before consulting them.

faq.question: How does AI Phill handle confidential business information?
faq.answer: AI Phill only uses information you provide in the current conversation. It does not store or remember past discussions.

faq.question: What if I disagree with AI Phill perspective?
faq.answer: That is expected and healthy. AI Phill acknowledges you have better information about your business and defers to your judgment.

faq.question: How does this compare to other AI business advisors?
faq.answer: AI Phill focuses on asking questions rather than giving answers, helping you develop your own strategic thinking capabilities.
